member.name: M:CSP.GateKeeper.decrypt(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The decrypt method accepts an ATTESSec cookie string in raw (undecrypted) format, a validation type, and an optional path to a directory for trace output; and returns the validated and decrypted attESSec cookie string.
member.param: the raw attESSec cookie string, before decryption
a comma separated list of the CSP cookie types (or a single type) that you wish to allow to access your application.
member.returns: Returns the decrypted and verified attESSec cookie string or an empty string.

member.name: M:CSP.GateKeeper.decrypt(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The decrypt method accepts an ATTESSec cookie string in raw (undecrypted) format, a validation type, and an optional path to a directory for trace output; and returns the validated and decrypted attESSec cookie string.
member.param: the raw attESSec cookie string, before decryption
a comma separated list of the CSP cookie types (or a single type) that you wish to allow to access your application.
(OPTIONAL) full path to the directory on your server where you would like a trace log to be created.
(OPTIONAL) an integer representing minutes in the range of 10 to 60, that specifies when the secure CSP cookie is not considered a short term cookie by this application.
member.returns:
Returns the decrypted and verified attESSec cookie string or an empty string.
An empty string is returned in the following cases: 1) The date stamp within the cookie string is in the past The date stamp is set to be 13 hours from the time of last login, giving the cookie a 13 hour lifespan. The date stamp comparison is done against the application server system time, so if the system time is significantly skewed, this could cause problems with cookie lifetime. 2) The cookie string is contaminated. The cookie may have been truncated or tampered with. 3) The validationEnv does not match with the cookie The cookie may have been created in CSP webtest, and your system is expecting a CSP production cookie. Or the cookie may have been created for a VendorID, yet your site only wants to allow ATTUIDs. In both of these cases, the empty string is a flag that signals that the user is not authorized to use your application.

member.name: P:CSP.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:CSP.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:CSP.My.Resources.Resources
